item.title: What is a Napkin?
item.description: Akin to the “Ponderings” page, this collection of “Napkins” is a collection of ideas that I felt were better expressed in a series of paragraphs as opposed to a question. Some of the world’s best ideas were incarnated on a napkin, these might be a few of mine. ​ The rest of this page will be a collection of examples for different features supported in the variant of markdown powering this website – pretty stuff.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Chris Kerwell Gresla – I am passionate about a variety of things including but not limited to: Artificial Intelligence, Technology, Music (Jazz in particular), Bodybuilding, Food, History, Cultures & Philosophy. For an overview of my professional experience, check out my LinkedIn or Resume. ​ Raison d’être Life is more fun if you add meaning to it, so here are a few bullet points from the current iteration of my Raison d’être.

item.title: Get in Touch
item.description: As a big fan of email, if you are interested in getting in touch, I recommend reaching out with your preferred choice of the following: Personal – ckgresla@gmail.com University – cgresl2@uic.edu Whether you are looking to collaborate on a project, work together, become friends or have a discourse – I look forward to hearing from you. ​

item.title: Items to Ponder
item.description: Life is far more interesting when you spend it thinking critically – the following questions are a few points of interest I have contemplated and implore you to also consider: ​ How far could humanity get naming astrophysical systems/bodies with cool names like Jupiter, Andromeda, Mars, the Jovian System, Alpha Centauri, Oumuamua, or Earth as opposed to the “XP-11213- Ac#4cP” style of naming astronomical objects? When was the last time you thought critically about something?
